poem:
### Two Faces of Spain

Water gone  
and water fierce—  
Chiva,  
caught in the clutch  
of extremes.  
  
Bridges surrender  
to torrents sudden,  
while parched fields  
ache for echo  
of rain.  
  
In the dance of weather,  
crisis wears faces,  
both thirst and flood,  
each a story,  
of earth undone.
